http://users.telenet.be/ahmadi/nettools.htm
This Website will also point right back here if you want to download using torrents.

HOWEVER - if you search for "NetTools" using Yahoo!'s search engine, it will report:
"Warning: Dangerous Downloads", which is provided by McAfee.
If you follow the "More Details" link, you'll find the following:

(WHAT HAPPENS WHEN YOU UZIP THE MAIN PROGRAM)
Net Tools (NetTools5.0.70.zip)

McAfee?s REPORT:
In our tests, this download was free of adware, spyware and other potentially unwanted programs.
Read and confirm HERE:
http://www.siteadvisor.com/sites/mabsoft.com/downloads/15763227/

POTENTIALLY UN-SAFE or DANGEROUS ZIP FILES WITHIN NetTools:
(These programs will be installed by unzipping "emailbomber.zip" and "exejoiner.zip")

Mail Bomber 1.2.d 3.1.0 (emailbomber.zip)

McAfee reports finding - "Generic FDoS.b Trojan"
Further investigation of this "Trojan" will reveal that it is NOT A THREAT - rather an ATTACK TOOL.
Read about it HERE:
http://vil.nai.com/vil/content/v_103054.htm

EXE Joiner (exejoiner.zip)
McAfee reports finding: "Generic Dropper Trojan" and  MultiDropper-CY Trojan.

The details on these 2 are lacking any real specifics. Although they are not listed as a "Tool", it would appear that "Droppers" are incorporated into many Viruses, Trojans, Spyware, etc.
Check out some of the "DAT Readme" info found at McAfee's "Threat Center" HERE:
http://vil.nai.com/vil/datreadme.aspx?seldatfiles=5206

MY CONCLUSION:
Looks like this stuff is on the level. It contains "Tools" that can be used for all kinds of NASTY PURPOSES, and it would appear that most Anti-Virus programs are NOT HAPPY ABOUT IT!

IF YOU'RE STILL INTERESTED, BUT WANT TO PLAY IT SAFE:
Download the main program and unzip it.
DELETE THE SUSPECTED FILES "Mail Bomber 1.2.d 3.1.0 (emailbomber.zip)" AND "EXE Joiner (exejoiner.zip)"

HOPE YOU ALL APPRECIATE THE TIME I SPENT CHECKING THIS ONE OUT!
